text:
Hi all, this morning I downloaded an interesting module from the marketplace but I cannot make a clone of it (see attached image). I asked support who redirected me to this solution, which is to ask someone here.
In my opinion it is a system error because I also tried it on other account and the same error comes out
Any ideas on how I could solve this?

Thanks

Giovanni

P.S.: I also tried downloading it locally with CLI commands but  ...Downloading @marketplace assets is not allowed
I think you need to create a folder directory first that's outside of the @marketplace folder. There is no where for the newly created module to go.
For example, if you had a child theme with a modules folder, you could clone it there
You can not edit assets (modules or themes) that are downloaded from Marketplace. Think about it... if you did, then the asset had an update... you'd download the update and lose your customizations.
There is no way to copy standalone modules from the marketplace
Ah, didn't know that - hadn't tested yet, but good to know. Any idea why this limitation exists?

Same reason you can't clone themes I guess. Although you can still clone everything to a child theme. 

You also could just manually copy the modules html, CSS, JSON :shrug:

I guess that makes sense - I just saw it the same way that you could clone a theme module to the child, you should be able to clone the marketplace module to a child so you can further modify it. I can see a lot of users that want to use the marketplace modules as a starting point rather than out of the box...
Yeah same, I've already had a few people ask me how they can edit our module
